intro: Trichopilia eneidae, commonly known as the Eneidae trichopilia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, compound leaves that are often finely divided. The plant produces umbel-shaped inflorescences with white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in early spring. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
